TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebRequestHandler extends System.Net.Http.HttpClientHandler

summary.span: 提供不可用于 Windows Store 应用程序或其他环境的特定以桌面的功能。

span.span: Provides desktop-specific features not available to Windows Store apps or other environments.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类通过使用实例将 HTTP 请求发送到服务器来实现传输处理程序。This class implements a transport handler using instances to send HTTP requests to servers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowPipelining { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowPipelining : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否通过管线将请求传输到 Internet 资源。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to pipeline the request to the Internet resource.
Returns .

value.span: 如果通过管线传输请求，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the request should be pipelined; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序使用属性指示管线连接的首选项。An application uses the property to indicate a preference for pipelined connections. 当 为`true`时, 应用程序与支持它们的服务器建立连接。When is `true`, an application makes pipelined connections to the servers that support them.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Net::Security::AuthenticationLevel AuthenticationLevel { System::Net::Security::AuthenticationLevel get(); void set(System::Net::Security::AuthenticationLevel value); };
member this.AuthenticationLevel : System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置指示用于此请求的身份验证和模拟的级别的值。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating the level of authentication and impersonation used for this request.
A bitwise combination of the values.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在相互身份验证中，客户端和服务器双方都出示凭据以确定其身份。In mutual authentication, both the client and server present credentials to establish their identity. 和 值与 Kerberos 身份验证有关。The and values are relevant for Kerberos authentication. 可以直接支持 Kerberos 身份验证，也可以仅在使用 Negotiate 安全协议选择实际的安全协议时使用该身份验证。Kerberos authentication can be supported directly, or can be used if the Negotiate security protocol is used to select the actual security protocol. 有关身份验证协议的详细信息, 请参阅[Internet 身份验证](~/docs/framework/network-programming/internet-authentication.md)。For more information about authentication protocols, see [Internet Authentication](~/docs/framework/network-programming/internet-authentication.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Net::Cache::RequestCachePolicy ^ CachePolicy { System::Net::Cache::RequestCachePolicy ^ get(); void set(System::Net::Cache::RequestCachePolicy ^ value); };
member this.CachePolicy : System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置此请求的缓存策略。

span.span: Gets or sets the cache policy for this request.

value.span: 定义缓存策略的 对象。

span.span: A object that defines a cache policy.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 缓存中当前缓存策略和请求的资源的状态确定是否可以从缓存中检索响应。The current cache policy and the presence of the requested resource in the cache determine whether a response can be retrieved from the cache. 使用缓存的响应通常会提高应用程序的性能, 但存在缓存中的响应与服务器上的响应不匹配的风险。Using cached responses usually improves application performance, but there is a risk that the response in the cache does not match the response on the server. 可以在 machine.config 配置文件中或通过设置属性来指定默认缓存策略。The default cache policy can be specified in the Machine.config configuration file or by setting the property. 如果资源的响应流已检索并读取到流的末尾, 则仅将资源的副本添加到缓存中。A copy of a resource is only added to the cache if the response stream for the resource is retrieved and read to the end of the stream. 因此, 对同一资源的另一请求可能会使用缓存的副本, 具体取决于此请求的缓存策略级别。So another request for the same resource could use a cached copy, depending on the cache policy level for this request.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ClientCertificates As X509CertificateCollection

summary.span: 获取或设置与此请求关联的安全证书集合。

span.span: Gets or sets the collection of security certificates that are associated with this request.

value.span: 与此请求关联的安全证书的集合。

span.span: The collection of security certificates associated with this request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan ContinueTimeout { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.ContinueTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置应用程序在上载数据前等待来自服务器的 100 连续的时间量（毫秒）。

span.span: Gets or sets the amount of time, in milliseconds, the application will wait for 100-continue from the server before uploading data.

value.span: 该应用程序将在上载数据之前等待服务器“100-continue”的时间（以毫秒为单位）

span.span: The amount of time, in milliseconds, the application will wait for 100-continue from the server before uploading data.
The default value is 350 milliseconds.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Principal::TokenImpersonationLevel ImpersonationLevel { System::Security::Principal::TokenImpersonationLevel get(); void set(System::Security::Principal::TokenImpersonationLevel value); };

summary.span: 获取或设置当前请求的模拟级别。

span.span: Gets or sets the impersonation level for the current request.
The impersonation level for the request.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 模拟级别确定服务器如何使用客户端凭据。The impersonation level determines how the server can use the client's credentials.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxResponseHeadersLength { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxResponseHeadersLength : int with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置响应标头允许的最大长度。

span.span: Gets or sets the maximum allowed length of the response headers.

value.span: 响应标头的长度，以 KB（1024 字节）为单位。

span.span: The length, in kilobytes (1024 bytes), of the response headers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 响应标头的长度包括响应状态行和作为 HTTP 协议的一部分接收的任何其他控制字符。The length of the response header includes the response status line and any extra control characters that are received as part of HTTP protocol. 如果值为-1, 则表示对响应标头没有施加限制;如果值为 0, 则表示所有请求都将失败。A value of -1 means no limit is imposed on the response headers; a value of 0 means that all requests fail. 如果未显式设置 属性,则默认为属性的值。If the property is not explicitly set, it defaults to the value of the property. 如果收到的响应标头的长度超出了属性的值, 则在访问响应时会引发异常。If the length of the response header received exceeds the value of the property, an exception is thrown when the response is accessed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ReadWriteTimeout { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ReadWriteTimeout : int with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置写入请求或读取服务器中的相应时的超时（以毫秒为单位）。

span.span: Gets or sets a time-out in milliseconds when writing a request to or reading a response from a server.

value.span: 在写入超时或读取超时之前的毫秒数。默认值为 300,000 毫秒（5 分钟）。

span.span: The number of milliseconds before the writing or reading times out. The default value is 300,000 milliseconds (5 minutes).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Net::Security::RemoteCertificateValidationCallback ^ ServerCertificateValidationCallback { System::Net::Security::RemoteCertificateValidationCallback ^ get(); void set(System::Net::Security::RemoteCertificateValidationCallback ^ value); };

summary.span: 获取或设置用于验证服务器证书的回调方法。

span.span: Gets or sets a callback method to validate the server certificate.

value.span: 用于验证服务器证书的回调方法。

span.span: A callback method to validate the server certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果为`null`, 将使用标准的知名证书颁发机构验证服务器证书。If the is `null`, the server certificate will be validated using standard well-known certificate authorities.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UnsafeAuthenticatedConnectionSharing { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UnsafeAuthenticatedConnectionSharing : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否允许经过高速 NTLM 身份验证的连接共享。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to allow high-speed NTLM-authenticated connection sharing.
Returns .

value.span: 表示使经过身份验证的连接保持打开状态；否则为 。

span.span: to keep the authenticated connection open; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性的默认值为, `false`这将导致在请求完成后关闭当前连接。The default value for this property is `false`, which causes the current connection to be closed after a request is completed. 每次发出新请求时, 应用程序都必须经过身份验证顺序。如果将此属性设置为`true`, 则在执行身份验证后, 用于检索响应的连接将保持打开状态。Your application must go through the authentication sequence every time it issues a new request.If this property is set to `true`, the connection used to retrieve the response remains open after the authentication has been performed. 在这种情况下, 将该属性设置为`true`的其他请求可能会使用该连接, 而无需重新进行身份验证。In this case, other requests that have this property set to `true` may use the connection without re-authenticating. 换句话说, 如果连接已通过用户 A 的身份验证, 则用户 B 可以重复使用 A 的连接;用户 B 的请求是根据用户 A 的凭据完成的。In other words, if a connection has been authenticated for user A, user B may reuse A's connection; user B's request is fulfilled based on the credentials of user A. > [!CAUTION] > 由于应用程序在未经身份验证的情况下可以使用连接, 因此, 在将此属性设置为`true`时, 需要确保系统中不存在任何管理漏洞。Because it is possible for an application to use the connection without being authenticated, you need to be sure that there is no administrative vulnerability in your system when setting this property to `true`. 如果你的应用程序为多个用户发送请求 (模拟多个用户帐户) 并依赖身份验证来保护资源, 则不要`true`将此属性设置为, 除非你按下述方式使用连接组。If your application sends requests for multiple users (impersonates multiple user accounts) and relies on authentication to protect resources, do not set this property to `true` unless you use connection groups as described below. 如果遇到性能问题, 并且应用程序在使用集成 Windows 身份验证的 Web 服务器上运行, 则可能需要考虑启用此机制。You may want to consider enabling this mechanism if your are having performance problems and your application is running on a Web server with integrated Windows authentication. 启用此设置可打开系统安全风险。Enabling this setting opens the system to security risks. 如果将属性设置为, `true`请确保采取以下预防措施:If you set the property to `true` be sure to take the following precautions: - 在受保护的环境中运行你的应用程序, 以帮助避免可能的连接攻击。Run your application in a protected environment to help avoid possible connection exploits. 如果你控制后端服务器, 你可以考虑禁用身份验证持久性。If you control the back-end server, as an alternative you might consider turning off authentication persistence. 这会提高性能, 但性能更高。This increases performance to a lesser degree, but it is safer. 有关更多详细信息, 请在[http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library)MSDN Library 中搜索 AuthPersistence。For more details, search for AuthPersistence in the MSDN library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library).
